intro: Sida hitchcockii, commonly known as desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features hairy, alternate leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers with five petals. Its fibrous roots help it survive in dry conditions, and it is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Sida hitchcockii is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low water availability.
